intro: Lechea torreyi, commonly known as the Torrey's milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family, which includes many milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its opposite, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-green flowers. It produces a milky sap that is toxic to many animals, including mammals and insects. Lechea torreyi typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
